name: parthenogenetic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
produced by or relating to a type of reproduction (= production of young animals or plants) in which living things develop from eggs that have not been fertilized (= joined with a male sexual cell): Human parthenogenetic embryos soon die because parts of their genetic code are unreadable. These rare animals are often associated with parthenogenic reproduction. Related word
parthenogenesis
More examplesFewer examplesResearchers have developed embryonic stem cells from parthenogenetic eggs.Four of the embryos showed signs of parthenogenetic activation.Suppression of chromosome condensation during meiotic maturation induces parthenogenic development of mouse oocytes.The narrative begins with the birth of a male baby into a species of parthenogenic, semi-aquatic women.
